stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains why the development of birth control technologies led to moral debates in postwar European society?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of technology in the later twentieth century.

choicesHtml: Birth control was largely only available in Western Europe during the Cold War.
Increasing immigration within Europe changed the population makeup of many European countries.
Many Europeans believed that control over reproduction was incompatible with their religious traditions.
Military leaders feared that the widespread use of birth control would lead to a decline in the number of recruits available for European armies.
